1.text: And Eli-Phaz the Temanite will answer and say,

2.text: Shall a wise one answer knowledge of wind, and fill his belly with the east wind?

3.text: Reproving with words he shall not profit, and speeches will be of no use in them.

4.text: Also thou wilt bring to nought, fear, and thou wilt withhold meditation before God.

5.text: For thy mouth will accustom itself to thine iniquity, and thou wilt choose the tongue of the crafty.

6.text: Thy mouth will condemn thee, and not I: and thy lips will testify against thee.

7.text: Shalt thou be the firm man born? and hadst thou a beginning before the hills?

8.text: Shalt thou hear in the consultation of God? and wilt thou reserve wisdom to thyself?

9.text: What knewest thou and we shall not know? wilt thou understand and it not be with us?

10.text: Also the gray headed and old man with us, great of days above thy fathers.

11.text: Is it small with thee the consolations of God? and a word covered with thee?

12.text: Why shall thy heart take thee? and why shall thine eyes wink?

13.text: That thou wilt turn thy spirit against God, and thou broughtest words from thy mouth?

14.text: What is man that he will be clean? and that he will be just, being born of woman?

15.text: Behold, in his holy ones he will, not trust; and the heavens were not clean in his eyes.

16.text: How much more abominable and corrupt is man drinking iniquity as water!

17.text: I will show thee, hear to me; and that I saw I will recount;

18.text: Which the wise ones will announce, and he hid it not from their fathers.

19.text: To them alone the earth was given, and a stranger passed not in the midst of them.

20.text: All the days the unjust one himself being pained, and numbering the years they were hidden to him terrifying.

21.text: The voice of fears in his ears: in peace he destroying shall come upon him.

22.text: He will not believe to turn back from darkness, and he was waited for by the sword.

23.text: He wandered about for bread, where he knew that the day of darkness was ready at his hand.

24.text: Straitness and distress shall terrify him; they shall overpower him as a king ready for war.

25.text: For he stretched forth his hand against God, and he will strengthen himself against the Almighty.

26.text: He will run against him upon the neck, upon the thicknesses of his shields:

27.text: For he covered his face with his fat, and he will make fatness upon the flank.

28.text: And he will dwell in cities out off, the houses shall not be inhabited by them, which were ready for heaps.

29.text: He shall not be rich, and his wealth shall not rise up; their possession shall not extend upon the earth.

30.text: He shall not depart from darkness; the flame shall dry up his suckers, and by the breath of his mouth shall he depart.

31.text: He being deceived shall not trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his compensation.

32.text: Before his day it shall be completed, and his branch was not green.

33.text: He will shake off as a vine his unripe grapes, and he will cast his flower as the olive.

34.text: For the assembly of the profane is hard, and fire consumed the tents of the gift.

35.text: He conceiving trouble and he bringing forth vanity, and their belly shall prepare deceit.
